intro: Lasianthus foxworthyanus, commonly known as the Foxworthyanus lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and emits a faint fragrance. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
